intro: Arnebia latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract arnebia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the bracts are broad and often resemble the petals. Arnebia latibracteata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun.
